review.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review.comment: A classic tale of wealth, love, and tragedy set in the roaring 1920s. Fitzgerald's writing is mesmerizing.

review.author: Harper Lee
review.comment: This book beautifully explores themes of racial injustice, empathy, and moral growth in the American South.

review.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review.comment: An adventurous journey through Middle-earth with Bilbo Baggins. Tolkien's world-building is exceptional.

review.author: George Orwell
review.comment: A chilling dystopian novel that serves as a warning about the dangers of totalitarianism and surveillance.

review.author: Aldous Huxley
review.comment: Huxley's vision of a future society, where happiness is prioritized over individuality, is both thought-provoking and unsettling.
